Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; creamy slip; exterior: two friezes of goats to right, divided by plain band; above, rump and hind leg of goat; rising roundel, rosettes and swastika as filling ornament; below, goat's hind leg; pendant triangle and dotted cross as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl (possibly)
Curator's comments: The sherd is from the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.20, 1888,0601.459, 1888, 0601.460.f, 1888, 0601.499.e and 1888,0601.460.e. Although Lemos does not discuss this sherd, she does discuss two other sherds from the same vase: 1888,0601.459 she describes as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dates it later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3). 1888,0601.460.e she describes as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl, rather than as by the painter of the bowl, because the sherd displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, albeit similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl (Lemos 1991, 74-5). However, the filling ornament on this dinos is not as expertly and evenly executed as that on the Aphrodite Bowl.
Bibliographic references: Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 132 note 29)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0022) (phase 2)
